entry.title: Influencing Functional Location with Object Type

How to make the INVNR field as input for a specific object type only for functional location.

Jaya

entry.title: Task List Operation linked with Functional location
entry.content:
Hi All , 

I have assigned functional location to task list operation & assigned this task list to maintenance plan . While generating maintenance order from this maintenance plan, functional location are not pulled into maintenance order operation . Can any one please suggest how can we achieve this ?

Thanking you .

Mohammed

entry.title: Multi-Technician Assignment in SAP Service and Asset Manager
entry.content:
Dear Colleagues,

I hope you are all doing well.

I have a requirement regarding the assignment of a Maintenance Orders /Operations to multiple technicians in SAP Service and Asset Manager.

I have not been able to find any relevant documentation, and Iâ€™m unsure whether this functionality is supported.

Since we are also using SAP Field Service Management (FSM) for dispatching and planning, I would like to know if the lead and supporting technician functionality can be leveraged in this context.

Thank you in advance for your insights and support.

Best regards,

SAP Service and Asset Manager SAP Field Service Management PLM Enterprise Asset Management (EAM)/Plant Maintenance (PM)

entry.title: Question about Higher-Level Item Linking in Service Order (SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud)
entry.content:
Hi Experts,

I have the following requirement:
I need to create a Service Order in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud with three items:

  • Item 10: Fixed-Price Service

  • Item 20: Operational Task (in Hours)

  • Item 30: Spare Part (EA)

I would like to use the Higher-Level Item field to create the following structure:

  • Item 20 linked to Item 10

  • Item 30 linked to Item 20

The reason is that these items are sent to SAP FSM, and I want the material (Item 30) to be associated with Item 20 in FSM.

However, when I assign a higher-level item (for example, setting Item 20 as the higher-level item for Item 30), the Item Category field becomes blank.
Iâ€™m not sure why this happens, what I might be missing in the configuration, and what exactly occurs in the system when the higher-level relationship is defined in this way.

Hereâ€™s a simplified example of my setup:

Could you please help me understand why the Item Category is cleared and how this hierarchy should be correctly configured?

Thanks and best regards,

entry.title: Requesting FM to have mass maintenance notification change - Field - Quantity Factor for Activities
entry.content:
Hello SAP Community !

There is customer requirement to update 'Quantity factor' (MNGFA)  of maintenance notification as mass change. Single maintenance notification have one or multiple activities to update the MNGFA. As I check 'BAPI_ALM_NOTIF_DATA_MODIFY' BAPI not having field to do mass change. Please let me know any other suitable BAPI or method to meet the requirement.

Br, Krishan

entry.title: Automated mass updates for Asset
entry.content:
Dear Team,

We kindly request your support in assessing the technical feasibility of performing a bulk data upload for multiple existing assets. QTY of 500 assets

Specifically, we would like to explore the possibility of mass updating the asset master records with new information in the "Time-Dependent" tab, including the following fields:

â€¢ Personal Number
â€¢ Department
â€¢ Division

Currently, the transaction code AS02 allows updates to these fields, but requires processing each asset individually. We are therefore seeking a more efficient solution that would enable automated mass updates.

Thank you in advance for your assistance.

Regards,

Dr. Aymen

entry.title: Materials Appearing at Service Call Level Instead of Activity Level in FSM
entry.content:
H,

Iâ€™m facing an issue with how materials are distributed between service call and activity levels in FSM.

Here is the setup:

Bundle 1 contains:

Operation 1 (HRE)

Spare Part 1

Spare Part 2

Bundle 2 contains:

Operation 2 (HRE)

Spare Part 3

When I release the order, FSM correctly creates one Service Call with two Activities:

Activity 1: Operation 1 (HRE)

Activity 2: Operation 2 (HRE)

However, all the spare parts (Spare Parts 1, 2, and 3) are appearing at the Service Call level, not at the corresponding Activity level.
As a result, the technician performing Operation 1 can see all parts (1, 2, and 3), but itâ€™s unclear which materials belong to which activity.

Question / Requirement:
I would like to have the spare parts assigned to their related activity in FSM (i.e., Spare Parts 1 & 2 for Activity 1, and Spare Part 3 for Activity 2).

I tried using the Higher-Level Item relationship in SAP, but encountered issues:

If I leave the service bundle without a higher-level item, I get an error message saying it cannot be empty.

If I assign the operation as the higher-level item, SAP automatically changes the item category of the spare parts and then I receive an error message.

Could you please advise:

Is it possible to have materials appear at the activity level in FSM instead of the service call level?

If yes, what is the correct way to configure the higher-level item relationship (or any other setting) to achieve this?

Thank you for your help.

Best regards,

entry.title: View future time based maintenance plans
entry.content:
Hello,

My organisation uses time based maintenance plans against all of our fleet. Is there a method to view maintenance plan due dates into the future at least 3 - 4 months out? 

Due to the nature of our organisation, there is a requirement to transfer work to a third party to conduct our overflow maintenance and I am seeking how I can see all of the fleets future dated maintenance activity to allow me to transfer early call-in Z2 notifications.

All help appreciated. SAPS4/Hana

entry.title: In S4 Hana Public Cloud there is only two control keys YBM1 & YBM2 , how to procure external service
entry.content:
Dear Experts,

In S4 Hana Public Cloud there are two control keys YBM1 & YBM2 there is nothing as PM03 as in on premise to procure external services.

In the above mentioned control keys if we add external work center with YBM2 control key its creating PR but that is not as item category D, which will not serve the actual purpose of external service procurement. 

Though  it could be achieved directly by adding Services in Service Overview, by linking external operation, but this is creating an additional extra line in PR which is non relevant to purchasing.

Could anyone help is there any possibility in S4 Public cloud to create a PR with item for SES, automatically from external operations as with control key PM03 (on premise), given there is no order type configuration in S4 Public cloud.

entry.title: In SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud, how can we restrict TECO (technical completion) of a maintenance order
entry.content:
In SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud, how can we restrict TECO (technical completion) of a maintenance order if goods issue has not been posted?
If goods issue is already posted, then TECO should be allowed.
Is there any standard setting or BAdI available for this control?

Jaya

Mohammed

entry.title: Translation issue in spanish for description of App F2661 - Find maintenance task list and operation

(Buscar instead of Bucar). When you search the App by the description you cannot find it because the translation error. Please help us to solve the issue. Trank you.

entry.title: In SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud (Maintenance Management), operation relationships restiction...
entry.content:
In SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud (Maintenance Management), we have created operation relationships (Finish-to-Start) between maintenance order operations. However, the system still allows confirmation of the subsequent operation even though the predecessor operation is not yet confirmed.

We would like to understand whether this is standard system behavior or if any configuration exists to prevent confirmation of dependent operations until the previous ones are completed.

Example:
- Operation 0010 â†’ Operation 0020 (FS relationship)
- Operation 0010 not confirmed
- Still able to confirm 0020

Expected behavior: 0020 confirmation should be restricted until 0010 is completed.

Kindly clarify or share SAP Note/KBA related to this behavior.

entry.title: Data Migration Cockpit error for Functional Location BOM
entry.content:
Hi All , 

System is allowing to create functional location bom using same functional location and same material code manually but  raising error message when trying to upload using data migration cockpit . The error message is that "Material does not exist or material is not activated " . However , when checking at t-code MM02 or MM03 , material exist . Has anyone faced this issue & how it was fixed ?

BR

Mohammed

entry.title: EAM Proactive Maintenance order cannot be found in Manage Maintenance Notifications and Orders(F4604
entry.content:
Hi,

We are working on the implementation of the S4 Hana Pulbic Colud - 2508.

After I created a proactive maintenance request by using Schedule Maintenance Plan (IP10), I can find the maintenance request in My maintenance request app and Phase is Screening, Subphase is Submitted (Request).

I want to create a proactive maintenance order by using this proactive maintenance request, and I cannot find the request when using Manage Maintenance Notifications and Orders (F4604).

I look into manual and find that there is one more step as Screen Maintenance Requests (F4072), and I also cannot find this app.

Please kindly advise.

Thank you and best regards.

Gao
